basic_data.name: Outdoor Escape Room Where Dark Things Dwell

address.streetAddress: 1000 Murray Ross Pkwy Black Creek Pioneer Village

description: An eerie spell has been cast over The Village of Black Creek. It’s up to you and your group to find the Witch’s Bell, and break the curse. Compete with up to 15 teams to uncover the curse's truth. Will you lift the veil from Black Creek in time? The experience takes place at 6pm and 9pm from May 31st to November 9th. Duration: 120 minutes

reviews.title: Unusual and Fun
text: Excellent fun, love the actors and the story to make it dramatic - the puzzles were unusual and fun to solve and required some thinking outside the box.  I loved the spooky cursed actors trying to distract you from the puzzles, that was a fun element!

reviews.title: Where the dark things dwell
text: I would really recommend this activity. The staff/ actors are so helpful and wonderful. We would have needed another 5 hours to solve the puzzles and finish lol but it really was tons of fun!

reviews.title: Awesome night out
text: Excellent experience! Scavenger hunt/escape room, something like we've never experienced before anywhere! And for an unbeaten team, you got us... ARRRRGGGGGHHHHH!!

reviews.title: Just ok
text: Went as a team of 6 this weekend for our first time doing one at Black Creek.   We are experienced escape room people and still found this extremely challenging.  Ive done some of the ones at Casa Loma and loved them so thought this would be a fun evening but left feeling a little disappointed.
In the end we made a good time of it but its a one and done for us.
Some things to note:

Your team of six is in a race to finish against the other teams.  Once one team completes all 6 stages the experience is over for everyone.  We were mid challenge and had to stop.  Wasn't even able to get an answer on how that challenge was to be solved.  We only got 3 of 6 stages done before it ended.  There was still time left but since someone made it to the end it was done.
Not all teams do all the same challenges.  So not sure if some were more challenging then others?
The website says that they start on time at 6pm and do not wait for latecomers.  Not true.  One team showed up 20 mins late and we all had to wait for them.
You do go into buildings but there is a lot of time spent outside so dress appropriately for the weather!
Location and overall concept was very cool.  Live actors were ok.
Asking for hints was difficult.  The actors hints were not overly helpful and left us even more confused.
You have to pay for parking on top of the cost for the experience ($10)

reviews.title: Amazing!
text: Murdoch Mysteries Escape room was really Enjoyable. The actors were superb. We had only an hour to find the location of the kidnapped agent. The plot was really thickening as we were revealing murder location clues, secret room, finding keys through all sorts of puzzles and a plot twist. Complete strangers worked together so well that we were able to find the agent literally in the last second. AMAZING!!

reviews.title: Team Building Event
text: We had a group of 30 doing this event and EVERYONE said they had a great time!
Thanks Secret City Adventures for a great challenge  :)

reviews.title: Escape Game? Or Dinner Theatre?
text: I don't dispute that this experience may be enjoyable for others, but it was not for me. I'll try in this review to reveal the elements that were not up to my expectations and hopefully this will help readers decide whether it's for them.

My party did The Dragon's Song escape at Casa Loma. This experience included two live actors who were with you in the room the entire time, and 'guided' the experience. When I say guided, what i mean was that they interfered with puzzle solvers, and would practically solve the puzzles for some people. This would be lovely if I had signed up for dinner theatre. The actors obviously were enthusiastic and talented, however when I sign up for a room escape, I would rather fail than have my hand held. This is poor design.

We had a party of six, and the rooms are designed for more, so other players are thrust together with you into a team.  In this room, at the beginning of each level of the tower, four puzzles were available at a time,  and worked mostly independently of one another. In my eyes, this created two problems, which only existed to try solve the problem of trying to fit too many players into the room at once in order to drive higher profitability. When I go to a room escape, I would like to be aware of the puzzles my team has worked through, and develop some understanding of how they worked and what needed to be done to solve them, even if I was not a major contributor to that particular puzzle. When 4 puzzles are being solved independently, the individual player is unlikely to be even able to see how each works, let alone contribute in any meaningful way to the majority of puzzles. When most of the puzzles are solved in a level the players who are not working on the final puzzle have two options, to politely wait around for the last group working on it to have some success, or for a dozen or more people to crowd around and catch up on what's been going on.

Lastly, at the beginning of the game, a Game Master (or MC as they called them) *specifically* instructed the group that there would be no clues on the walls. Normally, revealing the inner workings of a clue in an escape game online would be against my sacred code, however, in this game, there *was* a clue that was on a loose brick in the wall. While the instructions given may have meant to communicate that graffiti on the walls would not contain written clues, the MC instructed players (repeatedly) that 'there will be no clues on the walls.' Please train your staff as our team wasted a lot of time at this stage, mainly due to these incorrect instructions.
The decor and theme were impeccable, and there was a lot of attention to detail in props, you can tell that the designers took great care to design an aesthetically pleasing and immersive experience.

In conclusion, if you are looking for an active, participatory experience, and are tired of things like the medieval times, this may be a wonderful activity for you and your group. If you are an experienced and driven escape gamer, I would advise looking at alternative options.

reviews.title: Excellent!
text: Excellent!
Atmospheric multi-roomed and outdoor location. Puzzles, actors, themes, etc. were all brilliant.
My partner and I had a fantastic time!

reviews.title: Awesome Escape Room Experience in Historic Location!
text: This is a wonderful "escape room" experience in a historic & fun location. It works best if you go with a group of 6 people and can accommodate up to 60 people at once! Some of the locations are dusty and it can get muddy if it has rained recently but a wonderful experience roaming Black Creek and solving puzzles. The staff do an excellent job making the linear escape experience immersive. Make sure that you do the 9PM start if you want the best "spooky" experience.

reviews.title: So fun!
text: Our family of 3 went, we loved it! We were paired up with other people, but it was not a problem. My 11 year old had a blast and wants to do it again. We did the tower version and there were tons of stairs (a lot!) but worth it!!

reviews.title: Great Fun
text: We have done a lot of different types of escape games and Where the Dark Things Dwell is superior.  The setting of the Pioneer Village at night was very spooky and appropriate for the theme of the game.  We didn't beat the game but had a lot of fun trying!

reviews.title: Just go, it's a great time
text: Run around a spooky village guided only by lantern light. It was so much fun solving creepy puzzles and trying to navigate around in the dark. I'd suggest going in a team of 6 friends because the game is challenging and it's even tougher if you are assigned to a team with strangers!

reviews.title: Great time
text: Not a typical escape room. More like a scavenger hunt crossed with an escape room. I have no more to say but it won't let me submit without more text.

reviews.title: Spooktacular!
text: I would highly recommend this activity to friends!  The whole experience was fantastic from start to finish - the host was great and the cast made the game come to life - they did such an amazing job!  The right balance of creepy and fun, with a couple scares.   We went in a group of 6, and everyone had fun.  The cast did a great job of being able to help out when you got really stuck and push you in the right direction, without giving you the answers and preventing you from getting overly frustrated.  I would definitely go back and would love to try their other games at their other locations.

reviews.title: Fun and challenging
text: We went as a couple and got paired with 3 other people so there was 5 of us total. We ended up being the victorious group of the bunch. Puzzles were challenging but the people throughout the village did help nudge us in the right direction if we seemed stuck. Overall fun time and a great experience

reviews.title: Amazing Time
text: 1 review
5.0 star rating 9/18/2017

This was my first escape room-like adventure and it may have set the bar way too high - can't imagine going to normal escape rooms that I have heard about. First, let me talk about Jesse - the host with the most. Engaging and hilarious - loved him!! All the staff/cast members were fantastic - a perfect blend of serious/believable and funny/helpful. The puzzles/clues were definitely hard enough to be challenging but the fact that you really have the answers at your fingertips if you know how to look for them was great. It was pretty creepy at first with the masked, cloaked characters walking around but not too scary for the wimpy people like me.
I have told everyone I've talked to since Saturday that they should go - it was so much fun.

reviews.title: Can't wait to try their other locations
text: They put you into groups of 6 so we tried to round up a group of 6 to book at one time so we would be grouped together. If you aren't afraid to make new friends, then that's all good too but we liked working with people we knew because we knew each other's strengths and were able to divvy up tasks according to who worked well together (we're a slightly competitive bunch) :)

We booked online and you are given an email confirmation along with reminders. We were familiar with Pioneer Village so the paths are gravel and uneven so it may not be good for those in wheelchairs or folks that have trouble walking on uneven ground (Especially in the dark if you choose the later time, which we did).

The darkness gives an extra feel of spookiness but no one jumps out at you - it isn't a haunted house, it's an escape game. The tasks were challenging enough and pretty cool how to piece them together for your answers but staff will give some hints where they are allowed so you aren't left feeling completely stupid and frustrated. Most escape rooms give you two questions and then you can spend your time staring at each other when you're stuck.

At the end of the evening, our host Jesse explained if you choose to repeat this escape game, they have a few variations so I may try this one again although I am eager to try their other locations before returning to this one. They also have their banner and some robes for a photo op with your group at the end too. Love photo ops!!
Fantastic, loved it!

oh, p.s. they recommend close-toed shoes but really, it isn't mandatory. One in our group had sandals and other than some gravel getting in, it isn't like some other activities where you must have it for safety reasons so don't panic and go shoe shopping last minute, you'll be fine.

reviews.title: Great way to spend a fun evening with friends!
text: This was the third time we played escape game provided by Secret City Adventures. We keep coming back because they are doing a wonderful job! Puzzles are logical and creative, staff members are friendly and very helpful.

reviews.title: Escape Adventure Game
text: This was a great evening out with friends. A fantastic twist in escape room challenges.  You use in inside and outside of pioneer village which is great and even better in the dark by lantern light.
The puzzles are many and challenging.
All the actors involved really add to the experience and are helpful when needed in the puzzles
Highly recommend this evening out.  You'll love it!  Hope they keep adding new ones.

reviews.title: The night is dark and full of terrors
text: Very fun! and challenging! I'm sad to say that my group of friends did not make it to the end. Everyone does get to see the end feature though. 10 groups of 5 or 6 go out at the same time, starting in different buildings of Black Creek Pioneer Village. They have a 5:45 escape and an 8:45 escape, we did the 8:45 one so it would be darker and spookier. You solve puzzles (if you can) and move around the grounds. There are villagers around every task to aid you. Creepy guys in masks wander around and appear in windows. It was very creepy at first, but by the end we were having a laugh. We had a lot of fun and some puzzles we got right away, but a couple we needed hints. Only 2 groups of the 10 completed the escape.

This was my first escape room, and I really enjoyed the role playing and interactive aspects of it. I don't know now if i'll enjoy the traditional escape rooms where you're just in a room with stuff. It's kind of like the old murder mysteries. I'm excited to try some of their other escape experiences around Toronto and do this one again until I complete it!

reviews.title: Awesome experience!
text: We visited in June 2018 at the 6pm game. As the sun was still up this made the experience less scary but it was easier and more relaxed to solve the puzzles sitting on the grass in the daylight. Had a great time, actors and game masters did a great job. The puzzles were fun and the set was great! You will be in teams of 6 so it is suggested to go with 5 other friends if you dont want to be mixed with other people. The game is built for replay so I would definitely return and try the 9pm slot next time.

reviews.title: Black Creek Escape Game
text: Went in May 2018.  AWESOME experience.  We went to the 9pm group so it was dark and interesting.  Unfortunately we were only three so we got paired with another group.  We knew this ahead of time and of course it is understandable  from a business perspective but we didn’t like it.  Our paired group was not fun or chatty at all. So MUCH better if u can get your own group of six people and go together.  We are fatties but it was no problem. There is a bit of walking bending reaching etc. So wear comfortable shoes and clothing.  The puzzles were tricky and sort of nonsensical but always someone there to help. Few times literally had to be told what to do because we were clueless as to what the puzzle was asking us.  Haha.  The staff/actors were awesome. No touching allowed so that was comforting too but they are lurking around. You don’t have to interact with them if you don’t want to.  No pressure.  Just being in the surroundings was so cool.  Big group of participants but never ran into another group due to excellent planning I’m sure. Pay for your parking as you drive out. Pay station to the left.  It was 7 dollars.   We loved it even though I think we finished last.

reviews.title: Best escape so far!
text: For context, we have been to a bunch of escape room and this one is tops! Why? First, it’s done outside at Black Creek Pioneer Village either early evening or in the dark (go for the dark!). Next, it’s interactive with staff - it’s a full-blown theatrical production. Also, your team plays against other teams who you may or may not know, adding another level of challenge. The puzzles are great and the coordination is superb as we never even got close to one of the other teams as we were moving around the village. It’s creepy, and tense, and challenging and, lastly, everyone gets to join in at the end and feel like they solved it, even if they didn’t. Staff is awesome. Great event for friends, family, or work colleagues - the bigger the group, the better! Suggest arriving 15 minutes early. Parking available on site for $7 - get a ticket and pay at exit.

reviews.title: A frightening rush
text: We saw the experience online  during the winter and couldn't wait until Spring to try it out. It was well worth the wait. Where the Dark things Dwell @ Pioneer Creek was an exceptional experience. If you get the chance definitely spend the evening exploring the village looking for clues, solving puzzles and keeping clear of the white masked creepers. Perfect atmosphere and ambiance. Great characters and cast with a flare for drama. Puzzles that were varied for different skills and fun not frustrating. Great thing is you could go back multiple times to explore different areas with different pizzles. Would try this one again or perhaps one of their other adventures.

reviews.title: Brilliant Experience
text: From the moment you arrive, through the entire time you're there, the experience is meticulously curated to provide an immersive and believable game.
The puzzles were difficult, but solvable. The cast was engaging and committed. The story was well designed and fun.
That all being said, the true gem of this experience is the location. Whoever had the idea to host an escape game at the pioneer village deserves a pat on the back. Wonderful!

reviews.title: Great experience!
text: This was definitely one of the best escape rooms i've done. The way it's organized is different than normal escape rooms. The actors were great, and the story line was entertaining. It was nice to work in a small group and then compete with all the other groups playing as well. Everyone has a different path and clues, so you don't ruin it for each other.
Black Creek is a perfect location for this game and reminded me how cool the site is to check out again in the day!

reviews.title: A must try!  One of the best escape experience
text: If you plan to go, I recommend you go when it's dark or getting dark!  The atmosphere make this so immersive!  So much fun!  The actors were awesome!  I was so impressed with the acting, the story and the multiple locations that you go to!  You can also repeat this experience and let them know that this is your second try and they will make sure that you go to different locations!  Wow, wow, wow!

reviews.title: Best Escape game in the city
text: Went to the escape game at Black Creek Pioneer Village with my daughter and her husband and my son and his girl friend and had the most fun of any escape game we've tried ( we've done about a dozen in the past two years).  It is different than all the other escape "rooms" and is more like an adventure as it is conducted  throughout the village and its many structures (houses, schools, inns, churches  etc) and is a competition against other groups who are seeking the same goal as your group. If you like escape games then this is one you shouldn't miss.

reviews.title: Perfectly Atmospheric Escape Challenge
text: Where Dark Things Dwell is a great escape room challenge from Secret City. The village is the perfect setting for this spooky occult adventure. The puzzles are thematically appropriate and challenge language and logic skills. (For those who speak English as an additional language, you may struggle with some language-based puzzles.) The story is well-done, and the actors sure keep things creepy. This game does contain jump-scares although no actors will touch participants.

The host was very animated and organized, and all staff members were friendly and engaging when asked for help or hints. I recommend booking with a team of exactly 6. Escape rooms are more fun and easier when you know those on your team. Bigger groups will be split up and smaller groups will be joined to others.

reviews.title: What Dark Fun!
text: The atmosphere of the village itself is just perfect.  The era, actors, the setting and the story really come to life in Black Creek Pioneer Village.
As far as narratives go: this is BY FAR THE BEST STORY I have ever been in any escape room (having done 6 before).
The scavenger hunt style of this one is fantastic and the use of lanterns is genius.
Be warned if it's cold outside or raining you are subject to the weather, but that's a small price to pay for such a large playing field.
This is a must play.

reviews.title: Super immersive experience! Challenging and lots of fun!
text: I had only ever done one escape room prior to taking part in Where Dark Things Dwell at Black Creek Pioneer Village. And I don't think I could go back to a standard escape room experience now! It was so much fun - we were paired with a very sociable and friendly group. The actors involved provided so much depth to the overall experience. And being able to move around the historical venue kept things interesting and engaging. As a relative escape game novice, I found the puzzles a little challenging, but we were paired with a team who had done games like this before and helped us get into the rhythm. Definitely going to check out more games from Secret City Adventures.

reviews.title: Great experience for Halloween
text: Wow! I’ve done escape rooms before but taking the experience outside in the dark puts things in a entirely different realm! We had a team of two and were paired with 4 strangers who quickly became friends as we worked our way through the puzzles.  The actors throughout the game were great -if a times a tad over-dramatic (but that just added to the experience!) Simply put, Where The Dark Things Dwell is fantastic. Just the right level of difficulty.  I don’t want to spoil any of the game in this, so without going into detail I’ll just say, do yourself a favour and check this out for yourself!

reviews.title: Something different to try - and its fun!
text: Very well organized and actors were all in character. Challenging puzzles and secret hints. Great atmosphere at Pioneer Village near Halloween. Would do this again -different puzzles each time. Wont say anymore as I don't want to  spoil it - just try it!

reviews.title: Unlike anything else!
text: Our group of six escapers had an amazing time last month doing this escape room. It's a high cost compared to other rooms but you'll quickly see why once you're there. The actors are great, the cultists are great, and the puzzles were challenging, unique, and a lot of fun. The staff in the room were great at pointing you in the right direction while in character but not giving everything away, major props to the schoolmaster who was a standout act that night (don't know his name, he has a Scottish accent). Definitely not for the lighthearted but not too scary: I'm a self-confessed chicken and it was just enough spooky to be hilarious rather than terrifying. Without giving anything away, there could be some improvement on the latter half of the game just to make sure all group members are actually needed/included. It goes from being a setup for six people to something 2-3 could've done on their own which is a little frustrating but overall still an amazing experience. Love that there's a replayability to it as well, will definitely be going back.

reviews.title: Best Escape Room I've ever done!
text: Live actors, theatrical performances, exploring an old pioneer village, 2 hours of fun and scares. It seriously could not have been any better. Not only was this amazing, but you can do this again and have a totally different experience as there are 10 puzzles rooms and you only do 2 of them per visit.

reviews.title: Would have been 5 stars
text: Great experience, decent challenges and the actors are good at providing subtle clues to help you along the way. Very engaging and the game is well put together. Some of it takes place outdoors so it's a nice little adventure.

Honestly would have been 5 stars but about half way into our game, one of the actors asked us if we had something from one of the stations. We said no and then felt like we should have and needed them. We did not need them though. About 5 minutes later, our host came up and actually accused us, did not ask or inquire he told me I had something I should not have. He got lucky he would have got a mouth full.
I was there with about 50 coworkers that is no way to treat people in general and especially on a team building event for work.

That was rude and did not ruin my night, however it did have an effect on our group, we got singled out and embarrassed for no reason. He saw the look on my face like no, you are responsible for keeping track of your inventory. You need to investigate your colleagues before you come accusing the people trying to have fun and play the game.

reviews.title: Good fun
text: Did a corporate event here with 40+ people. Was very well organized and a lot of fun. Staff were excellent, helpful, fun and made the whole experience smooth.

reviews.title: Where Dark Things Dwell best escape experience EVER
text: I have done 69 escape rooms worldwide, and this is the best one I've ever done.  It's not really an escape room since it involves all of Black Creek Pioneer Village, but more like an escape experience.  I had previously done Secret City Adventure's Tower room at Casa Loma and loved it so I had high hopes for Where Dark Things Well, and all my expectations were well exceeded.

Many of the reviews below me already cover the salient points so I won't beat it to death, but everything is spot on about this game, from the actors, to the puzzles, to the way it all comes together in the end.
I have 2 major recommendations:

1) Do the 9 pm game not the 6 pm game.  We are so glad we did.  This experience wouldn't be nearly the same in sunlight.  But at night it's spooky and awesome.  The lanterns they provide offer enough light to do the puzzles.  I'm sure it's a little easier in daylight, but you're not hear for easy, you're here for AWESOME.

2) Bring a full team of 6 people.  We were out of town tourists but just so happened to have exactly a group of 6, which was perfect.  If you have fewer than 6, they'll pair you up with strangers, which obviously can be hit or miss depending on who you get matched with.  I was much more comfortable being with good friends who I could yell at when they didn't do things correctly. :)  If you have more than 6 they'll split you up into multiple teams so don't do that either.

reviews.title: Awesome activity for groups and corporate events
text: We are a large group looking for a great way to have some bonding, competition, and fun.  We have done a lot of different activities over the years but almost unanimously we agreed that this was the best one yet.

If you want to experience an escape room on a larger scale then look no further and sign up for this right away.  Very professionally done and the communication before the event with us was great to ensure that our needs were accommodated.
Thanks for such an awesome experience.

reviews.title: Where Dark Things Dwell is Simply Amazing
text: This is bar none the best escape experience that we have been to. From the folks who greeted us, the MC who explained the rules, right through to the end it was brilliant! The pioneer village makes an amazing backdrop and really helps you get into the story. The actors were great and being able to explore the village at night by lantern light was incredible. The puzzles were really well thought out and kept with the theme and had a great range of difficulty. Can't recommend this enough. Go for the 9pm game. You want the dark!!
